Articles.Content:
When a disasterously inefficient orbital climb left the Mun Lander with too little fuel to make the planned journey to our nearest orbiting body, Jebadiah reluctantly turned the vessel toward the retrograde burn that would bring him back home. Following the manic rush of re-entry, as the capsule gingerly floated toward the surface on its deployed chutes, Jeb sullenly thought over all the high hopes pinned to the mission and wondered if Kerbania would ever venture so many resources and so much effort to make another attempt for the Mun after such a dissapointing outcome. He was jarred from his thoughts as the capsule thumped down on the surface and settled to a stop. He then turned his eyes to the only capsule window and saw this...

The Mun...

Framed perfectly in the fiberglass opening.

As the beauty of the sight settled over him, a strong new resolve came into Jebadiah's heart. Whatever the obstacles, whoever the doubters - Kerbalkind WOULD set foot on the Mun, and then outward, into the Kosmos they would rush with their eyes wide, their minds open, and their hearts full...

_________________________________________

This screen was taken under these exact circumstances...flavor added
